bibl.title: Bacchylides Behind His Metamorphoses: The Poetic Identity of a Lyric Narrator in the Late 5th Century BC.
bibl.note: Revised version of a paper presented at the Classical Association Annual Conference 2011 (Durham University, UK, 15th-18th April 2011). - Introduction. - Bacchylides as a kean nightingale (Ode 3). - Bacchylides as Urania's cock (Ode 4). - Bacchylides as Zeus' eagle (Ode 5). - Bacchylides as an island bee (Ode 10). - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: Margarita P. Sotiriou, Bacchylides Behind His Metamorphoses: The Poetic Identity of a Lyric Narrator in the Late 5th Century BC.

Revised version of a paper presented at the Classical Association Annual Conference 2011 (Durham University, UK, 15th-18th April 2011). - Introduction. - Bacchylides as a kean nightingale (Ode 3). - Bacchylides as Urania's cock (Ode 4). - Bacchylides as Zeus' eagle (Ode 5). - Bacchylides as an island bee (Ode 10). - Conclusion.
